actor_awards.notes: Known as the 'Queen of the West', she was a singer, songwriter, and actress who starred alongside her husband Roy Rogers in numerous westerns. She wrote the famous theme song 'Happy Trails'. She received two Stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame (Radio and Television).

filmography.title: The Cowboy and the Senorita
filmography.role_description: The cousin of the rightful heir to a gold mine, marking her first film appearance with future husband Roy Rogers.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps a young woman claim her rightful inheritance to a gold mine despite the interference of a swindling gambler.

filmography.title: My Pal Trigger
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a horse breeder who supports Roy when he is accused of killing her father's prize stallion.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers is blamed for the death of a golden stallion and must raise its foal to clear his name.

filmography.title: Don't Fence Me In
filmography.role_description: A magazine reporter from the East who travels West to investigate the mystery of a legendary outlaw.
filmography.plot: A reporter investigates the mystery of a long-dead outlaw, but Roy Rogers suspects the bandit is still alive.

filmography.title: Orchestra Wives
filmography.role_description: A friend of the main character in this musical drama about the lives of women married to touring musicians.
filmography.plot: A young woman marries a trumpet player in a famous swing band and learns about the gossip and difficulties of life on the road.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination â€“ Best Original Song

filmography.title: Bells of San Angelo
filmography.role_description: A western mystery writer who gets involved in a real smuggling case on the Mexican border.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers investigates a silver smuggling operation on the Mexican border while dealing with an inquisitive female writer.

filmography.title: The Golden Stallion
filmography.role_description: The owner of a ranch who helps Roy uncover a diamond smuggling ring using wild horses.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers uncovers a plot to smuggle diamonds inside hollowed-out horseshoes on wild stallions.

filmography.title: Utah
filmography.role_description: The inheritor of a ranch who wants to sell it to fund her musical show in Chicago.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers heads to Chicago to convince the new owner of a ranch not to sell it, putting on a musical show to raise money.

filmography.title: Lights of Old Santa Fe
filmography.role_description: The owner of a struggling rodeo show who is targeted by a rival outfit.
filmography.plot: A rival rodeo owner sabotages a woman's show, and Roy Rogers steps in to help her save the business.

filmography.title: San Fernando Valley
filmography.role_description: The granddaughter of a rancher who tries to modernize the ranch's operations.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers tries to romance the granddaughter of a ranch owner while dealing with outlaws.

filmography.title: Song of Nevada
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a wealthy rancher who gets stranded in Nevada.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps a wealthy man's daughter who misses her plane and discovers happiness in the West.

filmography.title: The Yellow Rose of Texas
filmography.role_description: An entertainer on a showboat who is actually an undercover agent.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers goes undercover on a showboat to investigate a payroll robbery.

filmography.title: Bells of Rosarita
filmography.role_description: A woman whose circus is in danger of being taken over by a villain claiming her father owes him money.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers gathers several western film stars to help save a woman's circus from a swindler.

filmography.title: Man from Oklahoma
filmography.role_description: A woman whose inheritance is threatened by a feud.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps a woman protect her land during the Oklahoma Land Rush.

filmography.title: Along the Navajo Trail
filmography.role_description: A woman searching for her missing father in the West.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps a group of gypsies who are being threatened by a syndicate trying to take their land.

filmography.title: Sunset in El Dorado
filmography.role_description: A woman bored with her life who dreams she is a dance hall girl in the Old West.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers tells a story about the old west to a bored woman, who imagines herself and Roy as the main characters.

filmography.title: Rainbow Over Texas
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a Texas tycoon who organizes a pony express race.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers enters a pony express race to stop a crook who is sabotaging the other riders.

filmography.title: Home in Oklahoma
filmography.role_description: A newspaper reporter from the city who investigates a rancher's death with Roy.
filmography.plot: A reporter teams up with Roy Rogers to investigate a suspicious death at a ranch.

filmography.title: Out California Way
filmography.role_description: She plays herself in this film about an aspiring actor in Hollywood.
filmography.plot: An aspiring actor gets a job at a movie studio and tries to get his horse into the movies.

filmography.title: Helldorado
filmography.role_description: A wealthy socialite visiting Las Vegas during the Helldorado festival.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps clean up a gambling syndicate during the Helldorado festival in Las Vegas.

filmography.title: The Trespasser
filmography.role_description: A rare non-western role in this crime drama about newspaper forgery.
filmography.plot: A newspaper woman helps uncover a forgery ring involving rare books.

filmography.title: Apache Rose
filmography.role_description: A tugboat captain who helps Roy investigate oil gamblers.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers goes undercover to stop gamblers who are trying to steal oil-rich land.

filmography.title: Slippy McGee
filmography.role_description: A woman who helps reform a safecracker.
filmography.plot: A safecracker hides out in a small town and is reformed by a priest and a young woman.

filmography.title: Down Dakota Way
filmography.role_description: A school teacher fighting against a corrupt cattle baron.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers investigates the murder of a rancher who was killed to cover up a hoof-and-mouth disease outbreak.

filmography.title: Susanna Pass
filmography.role_description: A scientist's assistant involved in a plot concerning an oil-rich lake.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers investigates a plan to drain a lake that contains oil deposits.

filmography.title: Twilight in the Sierras
filmography.role_description: A parole officer working with Roy to catch a counterfeiting gang.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers goes after a gang of counterfeiters who are using a hunting lodge as a front.

filmography.title: Trigger, Jr.
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a circus owner who is being terrorized by a phantom horse.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps a traveling circus that is being threatened by a 'killer' horse.

filmography.title: Pals of the Golden West
filmography.role_description: A reporter covering the story of a border patrol trying to stop hoof-and-mouth disease.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers helps the Border Patrol stop cattle smuggling to prevent the spread of disease.

filmography.title: South of Caliente
filmography.role_description: The owner of a transportation company whose prize horses are stolen.
filmography.plot: Roy Rogers tracks down a gang of horse thieves who have stolen a prize racehorse.

filmography.title: The West Side Kid
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a wealthy man who hires a reformed gangster to fix his family's problems.
filmography.plot: A rich man hires a gangster to kill him because he is unhappy with his life, but the gangster decides to fix the man's life instead.

filmography.title: Swing Your Partner
filmography.role_description: A radio singer who gets involved with a dairy heiress posing as a worker.
filmography.plot: An heiress poses as a dairy worker to find out why her business is failing.
